question: Why do feet hurt when walking too much?
question_content: Each time I walk for around numerous hours, my feet then hurt especially my big toes. Such like this cannot be avoided on journeys out of town so why does this happen and is there anyway to relieve them?

answers.answer_content: Arch supports might help.  If you walk a lot you should look into getting custom made supports.

They aren't used to that much walking is the easy answer.   You can make them feel a little  better if you release the muscle under your foot, it helps with the blood flow through your foot so it has a soothing effect for your feet.  Here's how to release that muscle:
Foot Muscle:
With your foot in your lap place your fingers side by side at the back of the arch right in front of the heel and press in hard and hold.   After 30 seconds slowly raise your toes up as far as you can, release the pressure but hold your toes there for another 30 seconds.
For best results relax your body first by taking a deep breath and exhaling then remain this relaxed.
